sentences.english: I will have an in depth article on this topic soon.
sentences.chinese: 就这个话题，我稍后会撰文作深入阐释。

sentences.english: That hatchet man released rumors of a sex scandal to the press.
sentences.chinese: 那个撰文者把桃色丑闻泄露给新闻界。

sentences.english: That hatchet man released rumor of a sex scandal to the press.
sentences.chinese: 那个撰文者把桃色丑闻泄露给新闻界。

sentences.english: Edgar Allan Poe wrote an essay on it, guessing how the tricks were done, but was largely incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 爱伦坡撰文猜想机器人的机密，可是完全错了。

sentences.english: This is his first piece for Wired.
sentences.chinese: 本文是他第一次为《连线》撰文。

sentences.english: Imagine it is fifty years in the future, and a news reporter is trying to immortalize you.
sentences.chinese: 幻想在五十年后，一位新闻记者想撰文纪念你。

sentences.english: Every time when Wanderer wrote, many bloggers came to join.
sentences.chinese: 每每闻知游客撰文忽悠，许多网友就来报名。

sentences.english: Lucie Cluver has just written about this problem in the journal Nature.
sentences.chinese: 克洛娃刚在自然杂志上撰文谈到咋了这个问题。

sentences.english: Reviewers assumed that those subjects lost to follow-up had a bad outcome.
sentences.chinese: 撰文者假设失去追踪的受试者有不好的结果。

sentences.english: I wrote it for the student paper, "The Spectator", for a couple of years.
sentences.chinese: 我还在过去几年为学生报《观察家》撰文。

definition: editor in charge (abbr. for 責任編輯|责任编辑[ze2 ren4 bian1 ji2])
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
(publishing) (abbr. for 美術編輯|美术编辑[mei3 shu4 bian1 ji2]) layout and graphics/graphic design/art editor/graphic designer
to take a photograph/photography/to shoot (a movie)
